intro: Rubus hirtus var. brachyandrus, commonly known as the short-styled blackberry, is a shrub native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its thorny stems and trifoliate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black when ripe. It thrives in woodland edges and moist soils, and it is often found in partial shade. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and local biodiversity.
